product_details:

Department : Women
Date First Available : August 10, 2022
ASIN : B0B9937BS2
Country of Origin : China
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
review: I bought two of these bags. The dusty blue and dark grey. They are both great, but the dusty blue is more like a light sea foam green. I’m keeping the dark grey and returning the dusty blue. Had it actually been a lighter blue color I would have kept. The bag is a good size and seems sturdy. I would recommend for a good crossbody bag!

product_name: EVVE Women's Saffiano Crossbody Camera Bag Designer Shoulder Purse with Chain and Leather Strap
product_details:
Package Dimensions : 10.79 x 7.87 x 2.99 inches; 10.86 Ounces
Department : Women
Date First Available : August 10, 2022
ASIN : B0B9937BS2
Country of Origin : China
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
review: I really enjoyed this purse a lot, but it is very very stiff. That’s a bonus for the body of the purse, but I could never get the storage from the handle loops/shoulder loops to ever run wind from the original position to be smooth and seamless, so it always had kinks in it from storage and mailing. I did like that the purse itself was very hard bodied, so I could keep things in it, without things popping through or showing, but it was kind of hard to reach and without grazing my hand against the zipper or hard to see in to see what I had inside. Overall, it was a good purchase, but I don’t know if I would re-purchase again. I am satisfied with it though, and I will keep it and I will use it again but it’s probably gonna take a long time for the shoulder straps to ever unkink themselves if at all.

product_name: EVVE Women's Saffiano Crossbody Camera Bag Designer Shoulder Purse with Chain and Leather Strap
product_details:
Package Dimensions : 10.79 x 7.87 x 2.99 inches; 10.86 Ounces
Department : Women
Date First Available : August 10, 2022
ASIN : B0B9937BS2
Country of Origin : China
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
review: I wore this purse on a day cruise. It’s a very nice bag. The perfect size for the summer if you don't want to carry a large purse. I like the fact that it’s a cross body so I could have my hands free. I was able to carry my phone and several other essentials. The strap is adjustable and the quality is really great. I’m loving this emerald green color. The purse is versatile so it can be worn for many different occasions. I need more colors.

product_name: EVVE Women's Saffiano Crossbody Camera Bag Designer Shoulder Purse with Chain and Leather Strap
product_details:
Package Dimensions : 10.79 x 7.87 x 2.99 inches; 10.86 Ounces
Department : Women
Date First Available : August 10, 2022
ASIN : B0B9937BS2
Country of Origin : China
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
review: I ordered the EVVE Women's Saffiano Crossbody Camera Bag in the color Kelly Green. This is a very cute bag for the price point! My wardrobe is comprised of mainly all neutral colors. I like the simplicity of black/white/gray/tan/denim. So, I really surprised myself by ordering a green purse, and I'm happy that I did. It matches almost everything that I wear. This kelly green is a beautiful rich jewel-tone shade of green. It was perfect to carry in December for the Christmas season. I anticipate it working equally as well in the Spring. The gold chain strap and gold hardware are beautiful, and really dress this bag up. The only negative thing that I will say is that the green strap was showing wear upon arrival. It is not that noticeable unless you are looking for it, but I do not expect this to be an item that I will have in my closet for years to come. But, if you are looking for an inexpensive bag for a season or two, this is a great choice!

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
review: This jacket is so nice! Not heavy, not bulky, just right! The first day I wore it I was sweating after about an hour of wearing it thinking I needed it but the moment I took it off I was freezing again. It’s got so many pockets and zippers for flow of air. I think everyday I learn something new I love about it. Like the hood can be folded in the zipper and stores or simply taken off with a zipper. I am happy with my purchase for sure!!! 5*

product_name: MAGCOMSEN Men's Tactical Jacket Winter Snow Ski Jacket Water Resistant Softshell Fleece Lined Winter Coats Multi-Pockets
product_details:
Package Dimensions : 11.81 x 9.84 x 0.79 inches; 10.58 Ounces
Item model number : MCSXCFY-66
Department : mens
Date First Available : July 19, 2018
ASIN : B07FPNPH1H
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
review: I've had this jacket for about 6 months at the time I'm posting this and all I can say is I love it. The jacket fits me well not to big or small in my opinion and it makes an excellent windbreaker plus you can unzip the under arms and lower back to get some air flow without having to remove your jacket, you can also adjust the hood to fit snuggly to your head which I love btw. Now I will say this jacket will keep you dry..... for the most part, it's was raining pretty hard one day and I ended up getting wet my forearms and lower back got pretty wet, so wet I ended up having to change my clothes but the rest of my body was dry for the most part if not for that I would give this 5 stars still a good product tho.

product_name: MAGCOMSEN Men's Tactical Jacket Winter Snow Ski Jacket Water Resistant Softshell Fleece Lined Winter Coats Multi-Pockets
product_details:
Package Dimensions : 11.81 x 9.84 x 0.79 inches; 10.58 Ounces
Item model number : MCSXCFY-66
Department : mens
Date First Available : July 19, 2018
ASIN : B07FPNPH1H
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Canada on January 21, 2023
review:
Great Jacket. Bought XL I’m a 46-48 chest and fits great that I can still put on a t-shirt and light sweater. Regarding size it does feel a little tight in the biceps. Wide pockets at first I thought were a little high but really like them, easy to access, and deep enough that have not had to worry if items falling out. Velcro on the arm is perfect for patches and my flashlight and pen holder. Being a inter months in northern Canada always have to have a flashlight handy.

Agreed the hood folded and zipped into the collar is like wearing a neck brace or life jacket when boating. If wanting to store it out it in the pouch on the lower back.

Overall this is a great jacket that I wear outside and w at 0° and with a thermal shirt or light sweater is comfortable at -10° definitely feel this suits my needs as a late fall to early spring jacket for daily wear. If wanting to be used for colder weather and layering I would definitely go to 1 size up.

product_name: MAGCOMSEN Men's Tactical Jacket Winter Snow Ski Jacket Water Resistant Softshell Fleece Lined Winter Coats Multi-Pockets
product_details:

Item model number : MCSXCFY-66
Department : mens
Date First Available : July 19, 2018
ASIN : B07FPNPH1H
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Canada on November 28, 2020
review: I cant write anything bad about this. This is not a winter coat but this will be my third one and it's by far now my favourite branded combat style jacket. Si.lly adding the thinker material around the body actually is warm instead of a wind breaker style. Never had that with any other jackets. So it's way warmer than any other ones I've owned. Zippers are ok hood is terrible in the colour walk around like a neck life jacket but if you dknt want it caught on something it's good for that but I'm not walking around with a tube on my neck. I think it's just cus they use thicker material witch is great it feel better even. These fit great btw! I like a bit longer but this is proper and I feel good in it. Jackets blessed! And if you never had events before holy hell bro you need them. Driving get to warm open your arm lit vents right up and cool off 🤣🤣🤣 amazing best kne I've gotten so far. Pictures dont lie! It fits great!

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
review: I can definitely vouch for how these tights hold up to water, because I wore them for the first time in pouring rain! I know they aren't described as water proof, but the resistance to water was pretty questionable as well. I would say they might do Ok in misty weather, but not actual rain. I was looking for active wear for cold/wet weather, ( I have a job where I have to walk outside for 1 hour trips throughout the day ). As for fit, I really like that these come in such tall lengths. I am 5'11" and 155 lbs. I ordered the 34" inseam in size L. The length was even a couple inches too long for me - but I like having some extra since I am tucking them into boots and most leggings aren't long enough for me and leave gaps between their ends and the boot tops. I think these would be warm if they weren't wet - the lining seemed very cozy on my way out the door.
review_title: Comfortable and cute, but not very water resistant.

review: These leggings are amazing. I took them to Iceland and didn’t even think about my legs being cold while exploring. The best part is, they were actually petite. Being 5’0” it’s incredibly nice to find leggings that fit nicely and don’t bunch up around my ankles and cause discomfort. I’ve ordered more leggings from this brand thanks to their more inclusive inseam sizes. Really wish there were more brands like this with many inseam sizes. Will definitely order more as the seasons change!

product_name: Yogipace,Women's 25"/28"/31"/34"/36" Water Resistant Thick Thermal Fleece Lined Leggings
product_details:
Department : womens
Date First Available : December 20, 2019
Manufacturer : Yogipace
ASIN : B082WZ85LR
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
review: I love the fit and the fact it comes in 34" lengths. They're intended to keep me warm at Disneyland and I tested them at night this week. I can comfortably wear these alone down to 46 degrees before I need to add a layer for my joints. There is a small issue with them sliding down when I sit since I have a smaller waist and hippy hips 36.5/50 but I'm hoping the inner string tightens the waist enough to prevent that. They are too long- I'm 34" flat but these wrapped under my foot. We took the measuring tape out and they are 36" marked as 34". My daughter ordered the same size in 31" and hers are 31" but the waist is a little shorter- more mid than high. Overall I love these and it's more an annoyance than an actual problem.

product_name: Yogipace,Women's 25"/28"/31"/34"/36" Water Resistant Thick Thermal Fleece Lined Leggings
product_details:
Department : womens
Date First Available : December 20, 2019
Manufacturer : Yogipace
ASIN : B082WZ85LR
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2022
review:
I just received these leggings and am quite pleased. I ordered the 34" length, and it is perfect, extra fabric at the ankles, so great! I agree with other buyers that the knees are a bit baggy, but not overly so. I ordered the xl 34" size.
I am 5'11" and currently weigh 169. I could have sized down to a large, and will in the future. These resemble black skinny jeans right now, which looks great, but I feel a tighter fit will look more "legging like". Did I mention these are amazingly warm?....I am glad I got the lined leggings, I ran out to do errands wearing the leggings, a sweater and short Uggs, and I was toasty warm. Love the deep pockets, my extra long phone fits perfectly, and the waistband key pocket is a great idea. I am so happy I found this company for extra long leggings.....worth every penny!! Over and out, bean sprout!
review_title: Super long & super warm! Finally...long enough leggings!!

product_name: Yogipace,Women's 25"/28"/31"/34"/36" Water Resistant Thick Thermal Fleece Lined Leggings
product_details:
Department : womens
Date First Available : December 20, 2019
Manufacturer : Yogipace
ASIN : B082WZ85LR
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
review:
I don’t do reviews unless I am brimming with unbridled enthusiasm. These pants are practically perfect in every way. The fleece lining is thick enough to be warm outdoors but not so thick as to look schlumpy inside. The coating on the outside isn’t grossly shiny but repels the level of mist I’d be likely to be outside walking in. The fit is perfect for me. I’m 5’5” and 130 lbs. I’m very long waisted, so I ordered a medium because I can’t stand pants that sink below belly button level, especially in active wear. These are perfect. No drooping or crotch sag.
I have a pair of the previous version that I’ve worn constantly. But these have thicker fleece, the more water resistant exterior, and A REAL POCKET. In the previous pair, the back pocket was fine for small incidentals, but I needed to have my phone with me when walking my senior dogs in case of emergency. With these I can be outside in all but the coldest weather and have a place for my phone!
These pants eliminate my previous need for wardrobe changes throughout the day. I can pull them on in the morning, do Pilates or yoga, then walk the dogs in whatever weather, go to the store or whatever errands I need to do, paint all afternoon, and I only need to change if I’m going out to dinner, which, let’s face it, isn’t exactly a happening thing these days. I’ll probably order another pair to keep at our vacation home, and maybe an extra for laundry day. Seriously, I never gush about garments. And what can you say about a pair of black leggings, really. These just check all the boxes for me. If I had to design a pair myself, it would be these.
review_title: Finally - perfect indoor/outdoor all day leggings

product_name: Timex Men's Expedition Acadia Full Size Watch
product_details:
Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No
Language : English
Product Dimensions : 5.12 x 5.12 x 5.12 inches; 1.12 Ounces
Item model number : T42571
Department : mens
Batteries : 1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
Date First Available : June 6, 2004
Manufacturer : Timex
ASIN : B000SZNSVA
Country of Origin : Philippines
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2021
review:
Summary: This is a review for the black "Camper" style Expedition watch with a black Velcro Fast Wrap band. This style is unique from the other Expedition Acadia watches offered by Amazon in that it has water resistance of 100M instead of 50M for the other models. I have seen some non-Amazon reviews showing this same black Timex Expedition watch with 50M water resistance, but mine is 100M. I believe that there is also a white dial version of this watch, too, that is available on Amazon, but it is listed separately from the other Acadia models.

A quick rundown of watch details: 38mm resin case, quartz movement, 100M water resistant, Indiglo, push crown at 3 o'clock with modest protectors flanking the crown, date complication, hackable second hand, stainless steel screw down case back, Fast Wrap Velcro band, black dial, white Arabic numerals, small military time designations, flush acrylic face, white lumed minute and hour hands, and red second hand. All in all, a very simple watch design.

Pros: Easy to read, durable, light weight, the second hand lines up with the dial markers, accurate, very comfortable band, excellent water resistance, Indiglo backlighting feature is excellent

Cons: None, really. If I had to come up with some, I would say average lume on hands, will eventually have to replace the battery

Review: The first thing I would say is that if you can still find one of these and you are in the market for a solid, dependable military-style field watch, stop reading this and buy it now while you can. At 30-ish dollars, you can't go wrong and there isn't much to lose.

I have always been hard on watches. I have a digital Casio G-Shock, but I wanted a simple, analog field watch (without all the *stuff* on it) as a different style of beater watch. After some searching and looking at a lot of different watch reviews online (including reviews from soldiers who purchased Timex Campers like this one at the PX and wore them in the field), this popped up on Amazon and I purchased it.

I have had it for a little over a month now and it has been a faithful companion during that time. I don't go out of my way to abuse my possessions, but this Timex hasn't been coddled, either. It's gone to work with me in an office setting, but it also does real yardwork with me, I have taken it hiking, I have submerged it in water, I workout with it on, and I have had no problems with it at all. It has gotten a little scuffed up and dirty, but it cleans up nicely, including the Velcro. It has gotten a few good bumps and it's just fine. The face isn't rounded and doesn't stick out above the surface of the watch, so it won't get scratched up so easily. When it does invariably get scratched though, it should be easy enough to polish out the blemishes.

For what it's worth, if you are looking for a comfortable band, particularly if you have a larger wrist like I do (8"), the Velcro band is really nice. It fits perfectly every time, it isn't scratchy at all, it dries out quickly, it stays secure at all times, and it never feels sticky like the regular resin-type bands do. I wasn't sure if I would like it, but now I'm not sure if I would want to go back to another resin band.

The watch has been fairly accurate. As soon as I received it from Amazon, I set it using www.time.gov. During the time that I have had it, it has lost only four seconds. That's not too bad at all. With a quartz movement, I didn't expect any less. It is easy to set both the time and date. The second hand is hackable, so synchronized time-setting is possible.

The uncluttered dial is easy to read. The numbers are crisp. The hands are clear. The date window doesn't require a second look. One of the characteristics of this watch that will please some of the more exacting watch owners out there is the fact that the second hand movement lines up with the markers as the second hand moves around the dial. Some watches have analog movements where the second hand fails to properly land on the markers, but not this one!

The watch isn't too large, so it slips nicely under one's sleeve, but yet it isn't so small that it looks like a kid's timepiece. Even as a bigger, taller guy with a larger wrist, the watch still looks appropriate on me. It is also very light and I forget that I'm wearing a watch.

There really aren't too many things that I don't like about the watch. The lume on the hands isn't outstanding. It's fine, but what lume it has is not going to garner awards. The hour and minute hands have lume, but there is no lume on the dial or second hand. That said, it is important to remember that this is not a dive watch. The Indiglo works very nicely though. In absolute darkness, the Indiglo function works perfectly.

Having to replace the watch battery someday will stink, but only because I worry about losing water resistance due to improper battery and O-ring installation. I like the watch enough that I will probably just pay to send it to Timex, have them replace the battery, give it a once over, and then ship it back to me. I would rather have the manufacturer do it right than have a jeweler screw it up. Yeah, I know, it's only a $30 watch, but it's a really well-designed $30 watch and I like it. It feels like somebody took time to engineer this watch right. It may sound kind of silly, but it's like somebody actually cared when this watch was being designed and built. It is a lot like driving past a simple, old building in town that has a special architectural character to it. It just looks and feels like it was thoughtfully designed to do something very specific. That's what this watch is like.

That leads me to my last point. I may be wrong, but I don't think Timex makes this model anymore. Why not? They make a lot of other ones that are prettier, have GPS, can pay for groceries, or whatever, but they aren't going to last like this one. This is a tremendous watch and blows away all of the other Expedition models. Why is it that such a great watch like this gets discontinued? Is it because it is too old-fashioned? Is it boring? Nobody bought it? Well, if it pops up for sale on Amazon, and you're in the market for this simple, camper-style watch, you should plunk down your $30 or so and get it. Many times, the old-fashioned, "boring" ones make the best life partners.
review_title: Many Times, the Old-Fashioned, "Boring" Ones Make the Best Life Partners

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 5, 2023
review: Having worn this watch almost every day since January 2009, I've found it very reliable. I'm on my 3rd strap and 5th battery. The "glow" function doesn't work as well as it did, but after 14 years faithful service I've got no intention of replacing it and it's "good enough". I bought my for £13.39 and they've obviously put the price up as its just too reliable. I've been hiking, fishing, camping and wild camping with it on an never had a problem. I've never taken it swimming, so can't comment on that. I only looked at the page to see if they still sell them as I'd buy a replacement without hesitation. If you're of the "buy once, repair rather than replace" mindset then this is a good, no frills, reliable watch.

review:
Ich liebe diese Uhr! Sie hat meine Erwartungen sogar übertroffen. Ich trage sie seit über 1 Jahr fast täglich und habe sie vielseitig getestet.
Hitze - 2 Wochen auf Lanzarote (u.A. in der Wüste bei über 35°C
Wasser - beim Schwimmen mit Chlorwasser keine Probleme
Beim Duschen ebenfalls keine Probleme
Kälte - bei -15°C in Schweden, alles ohne Probleme.
Das NATO Armband ist, trotz der Verstärkung und Steifigkeit sehr angenehm zu tragen, sodass ich die Uhr sogar beim Schlafen am Handgelenk lasse.
Bei handwerklichen Arbeiten wie Sägen, Hämmern etc. war auch alles schick.
Einzig das Glas hat (verständlicherweise) gelitten. Ich werde es demnächst mit entsprechender Politur wieder glätten.
Wer eine robuste Outdoor und Alltagsuhr sucht, sollte hier zugreifen!

product_name: Carterjett Compatible with Apple Watch Band 41/40/38mm XL Nylon Army Green iWatch Replacement Strap EXTRA LARGE Woven Canvas, Military Style Loop Buckle for Series 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 & SE (38 40 41 XXL Olive)
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2017
review:
*Update 11/20
•Back On 11/15 I received a very honest email following up on my initial review which was the first time any vendor has contacted me, and genuinely cared so in-depth about customer service.
Initially I didn’t see it because it got buried in with this a flood of junk mail, and I am also very distracted by medical stuff I’m dealing with and I completely forgot to write back, but ended up at the hospital anyway so I was pretty occupied lol!
Coming back home I was surprised to find another email, this time from one of the owners (I know, right? I'm talking at the top level they care!) who sent me a very unexpectedly touching email, and reiterated that they stand behind their products— and it seems they actually treat people with kindness!
She offered an exchange or refund even though it was way back at the end of Aug when I bought it, and conveyed something very unusual and great that seems to be going extinct: caring about your customers!
I couldn't be more impressed with how they not only went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied and offered to send a different band regardless of how much time had elapsed. It was funny, because the Top Brass that emailed me was also sympathetic to what happened, and I found it was like I was reading something from a friend I'd reconnected with, and to relay that genuineness and charisma in just an email, it impressed me so much I had to wait a good minute to reply I was so surprised; all of them are SO kind, caring, and dedicated and just based on how their standards of customer service have been light-years ahead of any other vendors -where I had much bigger item issues, and unlike Carterjett, the last lady I received a broken printer from actually said "I live right near you, I know where you are!" and was so horribly combative and nasty- I almost called the police with such a insane veiled threat over a LABEL PRINTER I used exactly 2 times! So you can see it is almost funny how TOTALLY opposite these nice folk at Carterjett are.
I have no hesitation in recommending them and their products - the quality of which, in all honesty, I meant to comment on in the first place because that made my frustrations worse, that they had a GORGEOUS item and knowing I couldn't wear it. Plus I was surprised because the band is well made, with an awesome design with that cool hardware and would be a terrific ice-breaker / conversation piece, I just knee-jerk-reacted when I had an allergy; but there was never any question about the quality and cool factor!
I think I was also upset I wouldn't be able to wear such a cool band THAT IS ACTUALLY BLACK- Not that faded grey every other "black" band I've ordered has been (I am obsessed with finding and collecting FUN, COOL BANDS and this REALLY IS that- it isn't their fault my skin had a reaction, I'm probably the 1-in-a- million it would be: people are allergic to all kind of things, and I unfairly rated my PROBLEM instead of the PRODUCT!
I know the rubber tire-tread band is super popular so since it's also hypoallergenic as well, they are being so generous and sending one of those. And it is also, from what I see, jet black, which I can never seem to find!
So I am so blown away with how much they care I am changing my rating to a 4— I am holding off on one more star in case I was just getting "the business" so I would change my review-but I SO don't think so, from their communications and sentiment, I am pretty certain that a new band will show upb Unfortunately, I've much more familiar with shady types -on here and everywhere- so I am cautiously optimistic!
If they are genuinely this awesome then I am going to send everybody I know their way, the world REALLY needs good kind empathetic people who actually deliver on their word and don't try to sell junk and swindle folks, even just niceness in general. So! I can't wait to see. It makes things less awful when you're having medical problems if you have something nice happen and restores your faith in humanity.
10pm 11/20/17

*********

Boy was I surprised after only half an hour I had to take this off and put actual Neosporin with pain relief on! It is so scratchy and uncomfortable. Such a bummer because it does look kind of cool. I know they say "suffer for fashion," or whatever, but this is ridiculous.
review_title: Beautifully designed w/ a cool factor; the employees are too—and make sure ur satisfied! Just test if u have sensitive skin

review: The warn out band in my photos, which appear on the left in both photos is my original band I bought from another seller a few years back for 6.99, it is IDENTICAL to the band on the right in both pictures and the band which this review is for, the only difference is that the band I just bought was about FOUR times as much money. I’d still be using it today if I hadn’t replaced my Apple Watch with a larger version which required the new band.

product_name: Carterjett Compatible with Apple Watch Band 41/40/38mm XL Nylon Army Green iWatch Replacement Strap EXTRA LARGE Woven Canvas, Military Style Loop Buckle for Series 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 & SE (38 40 41 XXL Olive)
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Canada on October 21, 2019
review: Out of the box I questioned the quality of the materials, but once I put it on I liked the way the thing looked with the black Apple Watch and it has proven to be quite robust so far. The long band goes around my thick wrist more than adequately but I can’t say that I am totally impressed with the required fold-over method for securing the extra length of strap, and I didn’t really want to take the chance of botching a trim and flame resealing of the nylon fibre ends. I’ve worn this thing daily for many months now (in sun and in chlorinated and salt water as well) and while it does show some very minor fraying at the strap end and sides, it shows no obvious signs of faded colouring. I expect to get at least another year out of it before it starts to show its age. Worth the money.
review_title: Robust, dries quickly, decent but not premium quality

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
review:
First of all, I'll preface this and say that in my house we have 4 Roku's already in our house, and this was our 5th. We all love the UI, and it is able to do what we need. I have a huge amount of TV/Movies/Family Video content on Plex from my server hidden away in the basement, and the Roku's allow us to stream it painlessly. Better yet, with private listening to your phone Bluetooth headset on the Roku app (I use this daily).

Anyway, when we bought our house in 2019 the huge basement has been almost untouched. This year, I have made a project out of the room in an attempt to make it a nicer place to be. Games consoles (when wall mounting arrives), etc. I picked up a 60" Sony Bravia for just $20 at the thrift store, and naturally needed a Roku. This one fit the bill. This is my 2nd Express stick, the rest are Ultras in my house. Really though, there is no speed difference between them in my experience. Both navigate menus and launch apps quickly, with no lag time. The only tangible benefit of the Ultra, is having ethernet. But since I have a Google Nest mesh network, on gigabit internet there was no need to order an Ultra.

As usual, I extensively tested this Roku once I'd got the TV mounted up and it works perfectly as expected. Rokus really are great little streaming devices. My only gripe, is the amount of data mining and telemetry these things send home to Roku HQ. I have a PiHole network filter running 24/7, and the Rokus like to call home. In my case, some 30,000 individual pings by means of 'logs'. Since it's filtered and blocked on my home network, I have no problem.
review_title: Works a treat on a new to me TV in the basement

review: I bought this product because my aging smart TV (2018) was having problems with Prime Video. The old TV would not support the Free Vee app, so I could not watch many programs on Prime. This Ruko Express 4K+ supports all the new apps and my Prime Video is working properly again. This was a snap to set up and get running. It is super-fast on starting up. Much faster than my old TV. The Ruko channel has many interesting channels my cable provider doesn't. Great deal for the price. I intend to buy a second one for a bedroom TV which has the same issue with problems supporting the latest apps. The voice activated feature works great but is not necessary for my needs. But still a nice feature to have. I will be buying another one, as I liked this one so much.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
review:
The Roku Express 4K+ has been a significant game-changer for my entertainment setup. I made the bold decision to cut the cable cord, and this device has been instrumental in providing access to a plethora of streaming content, including live TV shows. While it has many strengths, there are a couple of areas where it could see improvement, hence my 4-star rating.

Let's start with the positives. The Roku Express 4K+ delivers on its promise of bringing a world of entertainment to your fingertips. The ability to access streaming services and even live TV channels is incredibly convenient. It has truly revolutionized the way I consume content, providing a wide array of options to suit my preferences.

The 4K streaming quality is fantastic, and I appreciate the HDR support for vibrant visuals. It's a noticeable upgrade from standard HD, and it makes movie nights at home a real treat.

However, there are a couple of drawbacks I've encountered. The volume button on the remote is starting to show signs of wear, which is a concern for long-term usability. I rely on the remote daily, and I hope it continues to function reliably.

Another area where I see potential for improvement is the channel selection. While Roku offers an extensive library of channels and apps, I sometimes find myself wishing for more variety. Expanding the channel lineup, especially in terms of international and niche content, would make the Roku experience even more appealing.
review_title: A Cord Cutter's Dream, with Room for Improvement

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023
review:
Honestly, I got this for access to the Roku Channel. I’ve been a happy Apple TV 4K owner for many years and it can’t be beaten for picture, sound quality and integration with my other Apple devices.

Recently a new reality series, “Morimoto’s Sushi Master” debuted exclusively on the Roku Channel. This Roku device was on sale, so I went for it. I debated going one model higher with the new Streaming Stick 4K, but having Dolby Vision and the problems that come with heat build up when inserted in an HDMI slot on the back of the TV didn’t seem worth it to me. For me, the picture quality of HDR 10+ vs. Dolby Vision aren’t big enough to warrant the extra expense. Besides, I already have the Apple TV 4K that has DV.

Set up was easy, I’m pretty sure that adhesive strip is going to come loose the way it has to be perched on the thin top edge of my TV. The voice command search isn’t as good as the SIRI function on my ATV. “Morimoto” was heard as “more moto” and gave me no hits on the search. For a brand new show, it certainly was difficult to find manually on the Roku menu. Roku could do a much better job promoting their new exclusive content.

Once I loaded it, there was a lot of buffering trying to “resume” where I had left off the episode from watching it on the iPhone app. Finally I gave up and restarted from the beginning. Overall, I find the user interface to be a bit slower and clunkier than ATV4K, in spite of its simplicity.

I did a little exploring and did find some more unique content on the RC, like the very first BBC season of the Great British Baking Show. Bottom line is it was worth getting at the sale price to add some different content choices as an alternative to ATV4K. If this were my sole streamer box, I’d probably go up the product line to the ULTRA for the improvements in picture and sound quality, with built-in Ethernet connectivity.
review_title: Got it for the Roku Channel

review:
El catálogo de aplicaciones para descargar es muy amplio, está versión 4K aprovecha totalmente la resolución y tamaño de mi tv, las películas se ven increíbles, en ajustes se puede modificar la resolución a elegir, en Amazon, HBO, Disney hay contenido disponible para reproducir en 4k o en otros formatos de video bastante buenos y el roku los aprovecha excelente, curiosamente hasta el sonido de mi tv se escucha mas fuerte, limpio y con unos bajos muy buenos, lo recomiendo totalmente! 👍

PD: Al configurar el roku puedes elegir la marca de tu tv para aprovechar las funciones del roku y su control, en mi caso tengo una ALUX y no aparece dentro de las marcas compatibles, pero no afectó en nada su funcionamiento, el control del roku no puede usar los botenes del volumen y del encendido/apagado con la tv ya que no es compatible para sincronizarse, así que solo se tiene que usar el control normal de su tv, no afecta en nada su funcionamiento!

Lo que me gustó: Es de fácil instalación, enciende y apaga la TV además de controlar el volumen, reacciona muy rápido al control remoto y carga bastante rápido las aplicaciones y canales, trae muchos canales incluidos que se instalan a voluntad como si fueran aplicaciones, trae Netflix, Prime Video, Crunchyroll, HBO, Star+, Disney, Youtube entre otros, ojo: esas apps no son gratis, debes tener cuenta, si configuras dos con la misma cuenta Roku (tienes que hacerte una), en automático te configura el segundo igual al primero, así no tienes que repetir todo ni perder tiempo.
Lo que no me gustó: Debes instalar una app para duplicar lo del celular, aunque si instalas todas las apps en el equipo ya no es tan necesario.
Importante: Está versión no se conecta por cable (ethernet), es solo WiFi, lo alimentas conectado a la TV (Puerto USB) o directo a la pared (eliminador incluido), lo puedes controlar desde el celular también desde una app que te da acceso a los Roku con tu cuenta, lo recomiendo ampliamente.

review: Great deal during Prime Days. I wanted a 32 inch, but I wanted a 1080p and HD and there was nothing in 32 with that. I decided to go with this set and am happy that I did. The only thing I didn't realize is that Vizio and Spectrum are not affiliated. My Spectrum Wi-Fi is weak. very old house with a lot of thick walls between my router and my shed. I bought a $50 ROKU that has the Wi-Fi enhancer and that works great. I get my Spectrum through that. Never a bit of buffering, I am one happy camper. Once I got the TV adjusted it comes in clear as a bell. I love watching football on it while the grill is smoking up a good meal. It's a great TV for a simple area that will make a nice recreational area set. I'm not someone that would ever plop down 5 grand for a TV. this suits me just fine fr less than $170.

review: I bought this for my wife to use in her study as a replacement for an old 20 inch. The High Def picture was a big upgrade as well as a slightly larger screen. Also, it was very light weight and I was able to turn it upside down on my thighs to screw in the support feet. The whole thing weighs just a little over 6 pounds. On the negative side, Vizio tries to get you to use all kinds of video services so I had to decline a lot. All I wanted was to link up with our cable provider which was also easy to do. The instructions were not top notch but I watched a couple of you tube videos which made the set up quick and easy. Recommend the 24 inch a good second TV.

Best Sellers Rank #73 in Electronics (See Top 100 in Electronics)
#2 in LED & LCD TVs
Date First Available August 18, 2021
date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
review: This TV isn't bad as far as picture or volume quality, for a bedroom, as far as I can tell, at least. I did originally rate it at 5 stars, because when it first arrived we of course took it out of the box and plugged it in and everything to make sure everything on it worked, which it did, so it went back in the box for a little while until we got moved into our new place, which is why we bought it to begin with, but after setting it up in the new place finally, now it keeps randomly turning itself on, somehow. At first we thought maybe one of the cats stepped on the remote that was on the bedside stand or something like that, so we finally decided to put the remote in our dresser drawer to make sure it didn't get "accidently" turned on again, but it is still randomly turning on, which we realized is the actual TV itself turning itself on, somehow, and nothing to do with the cats or anything else, since the remote is in the dresser drawer now, and the dresser/chest it's sitting on is to tall for the cats to jump on and get anywhere near the TV, so at least once a day we end up having to shut the TV off, after it turning itself on. I'm not sure what could cause such a crazy issue with it, but just make sure to keep an eye on it and don't think you're crazy if it happens to you, because you most definitely are not! I wish we would've tested it out a little better during the 30 day return window, even though we weren't going to be using it during that time period, I just like to plan ahead, so I probably bought it much sooner than I should have, but anyway, the moral of the story is to just make sure to properly test it over a few days time period, and don't make the same mistake we did. Other than it doing that crazy stuff, the TV itself seems nice (would definitely be a lot nicer if it didn't randomly turn on by itself, but what can you do, lol). That's the only reason I changed my rating to 3 stars now, from 5 stars previously, though. Good luck! 🌝
review_title: Alright for the price, but does crazy stuff on its own

review: This TV has a very good picture quality and is packed with a lot of nice features. The reason for 4 stars is because during use of remote control there’s a slight delay in the signal transmission of the buttons pressed. So it takes a special talent to operate it. However, I would like to offer some advice: if you are purchasing a TV for an elderly person in the beginning stages of dementia, don’t purchase a different brand than what the elderly person has previously used because they will find it very challenging. I purchased this TV for my elderly mom and the best she can do is turn it on/off, I have search and select the channels for her. Today’s TVs are very sophisticated to operate by seniors.
review_title: Very good quality TV with a nice price.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review: TCL put time and thought into this TV. What I noticed with the TV and its packaging is that every part that is to be assembled by the customer is perfectly laid out. All you have to do is follow the instructions in the handy quick start insert in the box. I put the TV together on my own with a Phillips. TCL paid attention to the legs(stand) and made sure to provide silicone pads for the bottom so furniture is protected from buffing or scarring and the screws and grooves to assemble the legs came with a place holder so when screwing in the legs everything stays in place so no damage to the threading occurs when attaching the legs. The Input and Output panel at the back is easy to identify and connect cords. The TCL 32" was delivered on time as promised. I would add an additional audio to this unit if I was to share this TV with a room or crowd and mount it for better viewing quality. Overall I am satisfied with my purchase, price and it came quickly, in one piece and was a breeze to set up. I would recommend this TV for a small room or area and have it mounted for better viewing quality.
review_title: Great Smart TV for Small Rooms

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2023
review:
INTRODUCTION
---------------------------
A little run down. My short quest for new speakers came about when the Mackie CR3’s I had for 7 years decided to stop working. In that time, I was quite happy with them. I don’t produce music, but do video editing on occasion. My primary use case is casual listening to music/movies/games. In that regard, I don’t need to have the flattest sound available or desire it – I just like clean, distinctive audio. I’ve been using Sennheiser HD555 headphones with a Sound Blaster Z soundcard for about a decade now. I know there’s better sound options out there these days, but really, these do the job well enough for me and it’s not a necessity to upgrade at the moment. Particularly, I’m impressed with the Sound Blaster software and functionality. I can switch between headphones and speakers on my computer easily and with separate settings for each that changes automatically. Which seems it’d be a convenience barrier switching to a DAC. In any case, I was previously using RCA and have switched to TRS when trying these speakers. The sound is noticeably clearer and unearths sounds more hidden with RCA. I have to crank the windows output a bit higher, but it’s unquestionably better. I also don’t turn the speaker volume up more than half or 3/4th to mitigate noise. With that, I’ll move onto my experience with these two speakers I decided to try to replace my deceased CR3’s.

Upon receiving the Edifier MR4 first, I threw on some lossless tracks with some variety, albeit dated.

Some artists included:
Boris Brejcha, The Chemical Brothers, Erik Jackson, Emancipator, Gorillaz, Hot Chip, Linkin Park, Macklemore, MGMT, Nero, Paul Oakenfold, Papadosio, Pretty Lights, Rinôçérôse, Robert Miles, Sleater-Kinney, System Of A Down

EDIFIER MR4
---------------------------
Off the bat I wasn’t stricken with the high end. I like a crispness in my highs and found there was room to be desired with snares etc. But it’s definitely good enough and doesn’t invoke fatigue. Using an equalizer in addition to increasing the treble knob helps and with dialogue in entertainment; which can be a bit muted. The speakers have decent separation and pleasing bass; while having a sound that’s brought together coherently. I have an external bass, which I won’t be inclined to turn on often, as I can also amplify it through software. Playback is warm and easy to listen to. Pressing the power button once enables or disables Music Mode. From what I could tell, it raises the decibel level slightly, as well as the bass and mids for added presence, at the expense of some clarity. I’ll probably use Monitor Mode most of the time. What I particularly liked about these speakers over the E3.5’s is a perceived wider soundstage; instruments have depth and can lightly reverberate (while still having a flatness to them), which sounded more lively comparatively. Overall, these grew on me and I’ve been pleased. If they could be a bit brighter, there wouldn’t be much else I’d desire out of them.

ERIS E3.5
---------------------------
The ERIS has an adequate amount of treble and clarity in the high range that I liked at first listen. At the tradeoff of it being sharper and more fatiguing with prolonged use or higher volumes. Highs can sometimes be borderline harsh without equalizing; vocals can be sibilant. I turn the bass knob to the max at +6db and lowering or not touching the treble; which only does so much for lows anyhow. Bass is present, but it’s limited and not as full sounding – the frequency it can hit is punchy though. If you EQ more bass you can get a slight rumble, but nothing compared to the MR4. Even with a subwoofer, it’s not as full sounding. The lower mids don’t feel like they quite bridge to the bass. These speakers don’t sound bad and if I had no other options in this price range or hadn’t compared it directly to a pair with more lows, they might be acceptable. They can just be a bit flat and lifeless (which is part of the idea with monitors I guess), despite having crispness on it’s side. Honestly, I didn’t give this set as much time of day, as I kept gravitating towards the MR4’s; which didn’t make me weary with listening either. If the MR4’s weren’t around as an option, I might have compared with the Mackie CR3’s again. But doubtful: as I think their updated design is ugly, still have that green accent, and apparently they’ve declined in build quality.

BUILD
---------------------------
Both speakers are quite similar with an understated clean design and near identical dimensions. The MR4 seems to have a slightly better build and I prefer the the carbon fiber looking cone.

The volume knob for the E3.5 is smooth – the MR4 turns with an interval of 12 clicks.

The E3.5 indicator light is blue and brighter for my taste: I’d cover it up if I were to keep these speakers. The MR4 has a subdued red and green LED for monitor/music mode. Unfortunately, the green light has already started acting up and stopped working in less than a weeks use.

The bass/treble knobs have more length to them on the MR4 and are easier to reach back and turn than the E3.5’s.

The MR4 weighs a bit more and comes with slightly nicer speaker wire than the E3.5

The E3.5 has a detachable power cord – MR4 does not.

The MR4 tweeter actually measures about three quarters of an inch, not the full 1” they claim.

With both these speakers I could occasionally detect light distortion/crackling in mids and highs. Not enough to be detrimental for me in keeping the MR4’s. But also due to some solid portrayal, I could hear more of the noise added to the production of certain tracks. For example, listening to some Phantogram, where vinyl grain is frequently added. I believe the E3.5’s also displayed this characteristic, but I returned them already upon noticing more of this.

CONCLUSION
---------------------------
I tried both these speakers in various configurations of equalizing, but made most my judgments based on how they sound out of the box or their capabilities. The Presonus ERIS E3.5 can hit a higher frequency range; while clear, I found the Edifier MR4 sounded more pleasing and I could almost picture vocalists singing into a mic, rather than just sound coming from a speaker. This carries into the overall experience between the two. The MR4 can give me the impression of being at a concert or watching a movie at a theater, to a degree. I feel the E3.5’s are lacking a bit of soul, but maybe that’s because they’re not as warm. When switching between the two to compare, I found myself wanting to just keep listening to the Edifier’s and not switch back to the Presonus. It’s more lush with it’s prevalent bass for the size and highs can be more pronounced after equalizing (though, they still have an audible frequency ceiling, whereas the E3.5 reaches higher). Given, both these speakers haven’t had a chance for a decent break-in period; but that’ll mostly round out the sound that’s already there anyhow.

I’ve also seen more feedback in regards to the Presonus not working after only a year. Most products these days can be a crap shoot, but I’d rather keep the MR4’s for the sound alone and physicality of it (with the aforementioned differences) and hope I get lucky they last awhile. But the LED being faulty already isn’t ideal and I’ll probably replace the pair. I might look further into spending a bit more for different speakers. Though, it seems moving up generally doesn’t include an aux input/headphone output, which is occasionally useful. So, once again, it comes down to weighing out price/sound/conveniences. The MR4 really does sound decent for the price ($129) and I will probably just stick to this model in the end, since I’m not ready to invest in a DAC setup either, that’ll make it worthwhile for spendier speakers. Again, I'm not a music producer, so I can't speak to the decency of these speakers for actual production – you can find reviews with graphs. I'd spend the $30 extra for the Edifiers; unless pronounced highs are super important to you (especially for rock & jazz). But if you create music with any substantial caliber of bass and need to portray it, I’d probably look elsewhere than the Presonus 3.5’s. You’d likely be wanting larger speakers anyhow; though, you may be able to get away with it by adding a sub. If you do consider the Edifier MR4’s, just know there’s a small margin of highs that aren’t as present. But they can be a more fun listening experience overall and less fatiguing.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
review:
This is just two funny equates to this, if You really want to have some fun listening to some good music, simply get two of these subwoofers. One of these subs will enhance Your music on the low end, but two, and You will feel the bass.

Two subs actually fill out the room better and equally across Your listening area. Less volume is needed when using two of these subs equating to less distortion at higher volumes. Typically, people usually blow out one (their ONLY) sub by overdriving it constantly, which eventually leads to amp failure (sooner as opposed to later, if at all.) 50 watts continuous music may NOT sound like a lot of music, but it truly is, if it is clean and not distorted. Two subs and now You're talking about a 100 continuous wattage of music. I say continuous because I would not and do not play any of My speakers to achieve peak wattage, which is just that, peak wattage. Peak wattage can be damaging to speakers especially if the sound is distorted.

I have these subs paired with My Klipsch "The Fives" and I Am over the top with the low-end reproduction of music. Tight, clean, precise, rich, full and low bottom end. Metallica, Aretha Frankin, Fleetwood Mac, Mandrill, The Ohio Players, Chicago, Earth Wind & Fire all sound full and rich. I play Khelani (Toxic), The Gap Band (Yearning for Your Love) and/or Nipsey Hustle and the music is clear, precise and low in frequencies. My Genres are old school R&B/Real Rap Music (80's early 90's), Blues, Rock, Funk, Jazz and a lil Country to round it out. Elevator and classical music are NO-GO'S, and I don't want to hear about females being degraded, drugs or violence being falsely disguised as music. Real music involves real musical instruments that are played by real and artful musicians that have meaning and positive purposes. I love to hear musicians finger slide across and pick their guitar strings. And please do NOT forget the brass sections and woodwinds either! For example, Metallica's Unforgiven, most people focus on the lead and rhythm guitars, but in ALL SERIOUSNESS, the drummer is VERY key in this song. The drummer is the timing and rhythm keeper in this song for sure. And a good sub will help You to see this also, kick-drum, snare, cymbals, crashing, punching, beating, rhythm! I want to hear it all in detail and with clarity! These subs do a great job in infusing music with depth and fullness; and warmth when needed. All they need are the complementing mid and high frequencies and it's game on!

If You use two of these, they together can fill an averaged sized large room easily. My Klipsch "The Fives" and My ProSonus Eris Sub 8's do NOT compare to My Klipsch RF-7 II 7.2 set-up, NOR were they designed to. However, it does come very close to replicating the sounds that I get from My main sound system, and it is that sound that I was trying to achieve. Secondly, My left and right channels individually sound as one speaker (one sub/one of The Fives.) I set the gain on both subs to 50%, and from there I worked backwards in the direction of 0% using the sub volume control on The Fives remote control to make the subs function solely as an extension of the speaker in the low-end area. From this point, the master volume control is the only volume control needed for everyday playback. The crossover is set to 80hz. I use NO equalization, simply flat setting. I do NOT have to make any adjustments to My subs when playing music across different genres.

When You have ONLY ONE sub out, You must buy a Y splitter containing one male end to plug in the single sub out jack and two female ends on the V side of the Y. I then purchased a Y split sub cable, all three ends male. This Y cable plugs into the left and right channels on the back of the sub (You can also use a single sub cable for each sub, but it must be plugged into the L or LFE input on the back of the sub.) I have both subs' settings identical, or You can adjust them individually according to Your listening preference and room environment (acoustics.)

For Me, these subs were ideal. Also, I always use dual subs at home because of their inherent better listening acoustic across the whole of the listening area. Sure, I could have purchased a more power speaker with a higher output wattage, but even then, one more expensive sub does not sound a good a two less expensive, but good subs. In essence, two for the price of one, taking down two birds with one stone. Trust Me, had I purchased the more expensive single sub, at some point, I would simply purchase a second one to achieve the same results (balanced bass response across the entire room, as opposed to one half or corner of the listening area.

Klipsch "The Fives" have a 4" driver that is responsible for both bass and midrange frequencies. As a result, because of its dual role and cone diameter, they are limited on the low-end frequencies reproduction, though they CAN reach deep on the higher end of low-end frequencies. Adding a sub or two (recommended) allows the bass drivers to focus more on the midrange and upper end bass frequencies for bass tightness and brighter midrange. The subs are responsible for bringing to life those low-end frequencies that We so desire. The bass port is front firing, so placement against a wall is NOT a factor, but room corners and speaker placement are still in play!

I would recommend these subs if You love great sounding music, but don't necessarily want to break the bank in the process. Should anything change or the subs fail for some reason, I will post an update. Right now, the subs are a 5-star IMO. I use them for music ONLY, so I do not know how they perform in a theater environment or for those purposes.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Spain on August 3, 2021
review:
Pues, como digo: con estos obtienes más de lo que te esperas por solo 85€. Pero mucho más, ah! Y eso no es nada normal. Porque lo usual es que siempre quedes sintiendo que has pagado mucho para lo que rinde un producto. Son unos monitores que valen mucho más de lo que cuestan. (Al final incluyo una lista de TODO el software que viene incluido gratuitamente.)

Durante algún tiempo había estado posponiendo la compra de un par de monitores de estudio porque mi presupuesto es limitado y mi investigación me convenció de que tenía que gastar mucho más para obtener buenos monitores. Pero, entonces, estos comenzaron a aparecer en mis resultados de búsqueda. Luego vi un par de videos en YT mostrando sus puntos fuertes y estaba realmente intrigado.

Por el precio increíble tenía serias dudas de que pudieran ser tan buenos como la gente decía, pero decidí arriesgarme y probarlos. Y qué bien me ha salido! Ni bien los conecté me sorprendió que PreSonus pudiera conseguir tal calidad en un precio tan bajo y meterle tanta potencia en un cuerpo tan pequeño.

Son claros y muy detallados. La separación de instrumentos es realmente genial por el precio, por lo que son excelentes compañeros cuando estás haciendo una mezcla detallada. Al dejar la afinación acústica, los altos y bajos, en 0, se obtiene un sonido perfectamente plano que realmente me permite, por primera vez, mezclar sin tener que compensar a ciegas porque mis altavoces o auriculares tiene graves más presentes o son más brillantes. Así que por primera vez mis mezclas suenan igual donde sea que las oiga.

Compré los 3.5s porque por un tema de espacio. Esperaba sacrificar bastante potencia debido al tamaño. Sin embargo, como ya dije, sorprende la potencia por lo pequeños que son. Los tengo siempre a 30-40% máximo, porque más que eso ya es demasiado fuerte para mi gusto. Así que aún tienen un 60-70% más de potencia para que mis vecinos llamen a la policía.

Como dije, quiero un sonido completamente plano, que estos me dan. Pero eso no significa que no tengan un bajo agradable, y además potente si es lo que quieres. Temí que no tuvieran muy buen bajo por el tamaño/precio pero nuevamente quedé gratamente sorprendido. Si quieres unos bajos bastante presentes, pues con estos también puedes lograrlo.

Me parece que son bastante mejores que los JBL One Series 104 y Mackie CR3-XBT, que suelen estar en las comparativas. Los JBL cuestan el doble y creo que están MUY sobrevalorados. Los Mackie cuestan 20-30€ más que los PreSonus y en su caso, sí que diría “obtienes lo que pagas”. En mi opinión los JBL son bastante cálidos, lo cual no está bueno para hacer mezclas. Además, tiene problemas si los escuchas fuera del eje central, con que tienes que dirigirlos con mucho cuidado. Los Mackie fueron decepcionantes. Me parece que no son realmente para mezclar es estudio, sino solo son productos de consumo, como monitores de ordenador. El sonido carece de fuerza y presencia, y la separación de instrumentos no es muy buena. Lado a lado, de los 3 elegiría ciegamente los PreSonus como los más profesionales y más caros... La primera afirmación es definitivamente cierta; la segunda afirmación afortunadamente no lo es.

Para mí, PreSonus ha dejado de lado cualquier artificio de marketing, diseño elegante o moderno, gollerías estéticas, y ha invertido todo el dinero en el interior de estos monitores. El resultado es un par de monitores que puede que no ganen ningún premio de innovación en diseño, pero que sin duda son excepcionales en la calidad del sonido. Permítanme aclarar que no son feos de ninguna manera, son solo, digamos, tradicionales o simples, pero de buena calidad. Es probable que nadie te vaya a decir: Pero qué chulos se ven tus monitores! Pero al escucharlos, seguramente te dirán: Pero qué increíbles suenan tus monitores!

Está claro que esto último es más importante. Si tienes mucho dinero para gastar en monitores (y otro hardware), puedes pagar por la estética, así como la calidad del sonido. Pero estoy muy contento de que PreSonus haya salido con esta opción increíblemente barata de un par de monitores que realmente funcionan muy por encima de su rango de precio. Esto te permite comenzar con un gran hardware y obtener excelentes resultados. También te permite gastar en otras cosas importantes, como una interfaz de audio, controladores midi, buenos micrófonos, etc.

Finalmente, diré que si no tienes mucha idea de monitores, si estos son tus primeros, afortunadamente PreSonus te ofrece una gran cantidad de material de apoyo en su web para que obtengas el mejor resultado: ya sea instrucciones para calibrarlos, si eso quieres, para colocarlos a una distancia y ángulo perfecto, para mejor el sonido de tu habitación, etc. Además, viene con una GRAN cantidad de software pago incluido con tu compra de manera gratuita, incluso el Studio One, que es un DAW muy completo que aquí obtienes gratis! Y cuando digo GRAN cantidad de software, quiero decir GRAN cantidad de software, pues incluye todo lo siguiente:

✔ PreSonus Hub
✔ Studio One 5 Prime OEM
✔ Plugin Alliance - Brainworx bx_opto, SPL Attacker Plus, Maag Audio EQ2, Brainworx bx_rockrack v3
✔ Lexicon MPX-i Reverb
✔ Output Movement
✔ Klanghelm SDRR2tube
✔ iZotope Neutron - Elements - Studio Magic
✔ Native Instruments - Replika
✔ Cherry Audio - Voltage Nucleus
✔ Melodics - Studio Bundle
✔ KV331 Audio - SynthMaster Player
✔ UVI - Model D
✔ Ghosthack - Essential Sounds - Studio Magic
✔ Arturia - Analog Lab Intro - Studio Magic
✔ Cherry Audio - Surrealistic MG-1Plus - Studio Magic
✔ SoundSnap - 3 Months Free Coupon
✔ UJAM - Virtual Bassist - ROWDY 2 - Studio Magic
review_title: Una de las pocas instancias en que obtienes MÁS de lo que estás pagando!

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Germany on March 22, 2023
review:
Auf der Suche nach einem Lautsprechersystem für Audio-Arbeiten am Computer (Musikzusammenstellungen, Digitalisierungen u.ä.) oder einfach nur zum Eintauchen in schöne Musikstücke aus Rock, Pop, Jazz, auch Klassik bin ich auf die PreSonus-Lautsprecher gestoßen.
Anforderung war: optimales Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis bei einer für meine Ohren akzeptablen Klangqualität.
Letzteres zu Referenzzwecken kurz erläutert heisst für mich eine vergleichbare Klangqualität zu:
- Kopfhörern wie z.B. beyerdynamic DT 990 PRO 250 Ohm an Thomann swissonic HAD-1 DAC
- Dali oder Quadral-Lautsprecher aus dem mittleren Preisbereich oder auch einige Teufel-Lautsprecher an passenden guten Verstärkern von Sony (früher), Yamaha oder Marantz.

Beschafft und verglichen habe ich mangels genauerer Vorstellung zu den jeweiligen Feinheiten aus der PreSonus-Familie die für meine Raumverhältnisse am geeignet erscheinensten Monitore Eris E3.5, E4.5 und E5 zusammen mit dem Sub8 Subwoofer. Zuspieler wiederum der oben erwähnte Thomann swissonic HAD-1 DAC und der wiederum per USB vom PC mit WAV- oder FLAC-Musikdateien oder per S/PDIF von einem CD-Player gefüttert.

Ergebnisse:
Alle 3 Monitorpaare bringen jeweils für sich allein schon mal einen guten Klang, vor allem für ihren Preis, wobei die Eris E3.5 mit unter 100,-- Euro pro Paar beim Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis nochmal rausstechen.
Alle klingen klar und fein auflösend, mit präzisen Mitten und Höhen. Beim Bass muß man aufgrund der Größe natürlich Abstriche in Kauf nehmen, umso mehr, je kleiner der LS. Das trifft hier besonders auf die Eris E3.5 zu, aber auch die sind immer noch um Klassen besser, als viele PC-"Brüllwürfel". Erfreulicherweise kommt bei allen drei Monitorgrößen oberhalb der jeweiligen unteren Grenzfrequenz auch der Bass klar, sauber und trocken rüber, ohne wabbeliges Gebrummel, wie man es bei den vielen heute modernen "Soundmonstern" findet. Wer mehr Bass bei tieferen Frequenzen für den Bauch will, muss den Sub8 zuschalten, der dies prima und trocken erledigt. Der Sub8 kann alle 3 Monitorpaare sauber und auf Wunsch auch sehr kräftig im Tiefbassbereich ergänzen.
Was man vielleicht noch leicht warnend für Fans von Sonos, Bose oder ähnlich klangdesignten Systemen dazusagen muß: Die PreSonus-Monitore sind eher was für Freunde des unverfälschten Klangs.

Meine persönliche Empfehlung nach Vergleich der 3 Monitorpaare sind letztendlich die Eris E4.5, weil diese für mich am ausgewogensten über den ganzen Frequenzbereich klingen, mit einer Auflösung, dass es richtig Spass macht, die Feinheiten einzelner Instrumente herauszuhören (wie mit dem beyerdynamic DT 990 PRO Kopfhörer). Dies hat mich insofern gegenüber den Eris E5 erstaunt, als dass diese mehr Volumen haben und mit ihren Doppelendstufen (1 pro LS) deutlich aufwändiger aufgebaut sind. Die E5 wirken für mich im Mittenbereich aber etwas "topfiger" im Klang. Dann lieber die im Bassbereich schmaleren Eris E3.5.
An der Stelle mag ich übrigens einem Vor-Kommentator nicht zustimmen, der meinte, die E4.5 würden sich wegen der um 10 Hz tieferen Grenzfrequenz gegenüber den E3.5 nicht lohnen. Wie schon gesagt, die E3.5 sind sicher nicht schlecht, die E4.5 haben dann aber doch noch deutlich mehr Luft und spielen für mich klarer und freier auf.
In Kombination mit dem Sub8 zeigten sich die Eris E4.5 für mich am besten auf diesen abgestimmt.

Ein paar Hinweise noch:
Ich empfehle, die Auf- und Einstellhinweise in den PreSonus-Benutzerhandbüchern wirklich zu befolgen, da sich eine ungünstige Positionierung der Monitore und unpassende Einstellungen nicht unerheblich auf den Klang auswirken. Für mich klangen die Eris E4.5 im Zusammenspiel mit dem Sub8 am besten mit eingeschaltetem HP-Filter für die E4.5 und dem LP-Filter für den Sub8 auf 80 Hz eingestellt.
Das ganze System hat mehr als ausreichend Verstärkerleistung und kann bei Bedarf richtig laut werden ohne zu verzerren. Von daher sollte man die Lautstärkeregler der Monitore und vom Sub nur soweit aufdrehen, wie man es maximal benötigt und die Lautstärke ansonsten am Zuspieler einstellen. Dreht man den Lautstärkeregler der Monitore beim Betrieb über den Sub8 voll auf, kann es sein, dass man ohne Signal vom Zuspieler im stillen Raum ein leises 50 Hz-Brummen hört und dicht an den Hochtönern ein leises weisses Rauschen. Dreht man die Lautstärkeregler von Monitoren und Sub ein Stück zurück in den Bereich vertretbarer Abhörlautstärken, ist das weg. Mit Signal würde man das leise Brummen und Rauschen natürlich auch nicht hören.

Und eins noch - und das gibt bei mir einen Stern Abzug für den Sub8 - das Ding (der Eris Sub8) ist offenbar sehr empfindlich gegen Erd-/Masseschleifen. Also nicht wundern, wenn es nach dem Anschluß am PC ohne weitere Maßnahmen aus den Lautsprechern brummt und sogar pfeift. Dagegen hat bei mir nur das Abtrennen des Schutzleiters am Stromversorgungskabel des Sub8 per Zwischenadapter geholfen, also nur Phase und Nullleiter anschließen, was man aus Schutzgründen vor einem Stromschlag bei einem Kurzschluß eigentlich nicht tun sollte. Die Monitore alleine haben das Problem nicht; sie werden nur 2-polig per Euro-Stecker mit Strom versorgt.

Fazit:
Wer sauber klingende aktive Monitor-Lautsprecher sucht, kann mit den PreSonus Eris E4.5 aus meiner Sicht nicht daneben liegen. Soll die Bass Drum auch im Bauch fühlbar sein, kann man passend mit dem Subwoofer Sub8 ergänzen, auch wenn dieser mit seiner Sensibilität bezüglich Erd-/Masseschleifen etwas "aus der Zeit gefallenen" zu sein scheint.
Meinen Ohren bietet das System jedenfalls richtig Spaß und das Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis ist aus meiner Sicht top.
review_title: Sehr gutes Audio-Monitorsystem mit kaum Schwächen - Vgl. Eris E3.5, E4.5, E5 mit Sub8

Finding the perfect studio monitors has been a quest of mine for years. Enter the PreSonus Eris E4.5 High-Definition Multimedia Studio Monitors – these little powerhouses have completely transformed my listening and mixing experience.

First and foremost, the sound quality these monitors deliver is nothing short of exceptional. Whether I'm enjoying my favorite tracks or evaluating audio content, the Eris E4.5 monitors provide a precise representation of every element.

The build quality is remarkable, too. Despite their compact size, these monitors feel sturdy and well-constructed. The front-panel volume knob and acoustic tuning controls are easily accessible and allow for precise adjustments tailored to my workspace. I appreciate the flexibility to fine-tune the monitors to my specific room acoustics, ensuring I'm getting the most accurate sound possible.

Connectivity options are extensive – balanced TRS, unbalanced RCA, and an auxiliary input mean I can easily switch between multiple sources. The inclusion of a headphone output on the front panel is a thoughtful addition, allowing for private listening without having to disconnect the monitors.

What truly sets the Eris E4.5 monitors apart is their affordability without compromising on quality. PreSonus has managed to pack professional-grade sound into a budget-friendly package, making these monitors an excellent choice for those looking for a reliable and accurate monitoring solution.

In conclusion, the PreSonus Eris E4.5 High-Definition Multimedia Studio Monitors have exceeded my expectations in every aspect. Their exceptional sound quality, build, and versatile connectivity options make them an indispensable tool in my setup. If you're seeking a pair of compact monitors that punch well above their weight class, look no further – these little wonders will undoubtedly elevate your audio experience.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in Mexico on August 24, 2023
review: Compre las bocinas junto con una interfaz de audio Focusrite 2i2, cables balanceados TRS y son absolutamente silenciosas, no hum a pesar de que pasan junto a múltiples cables que pueden causar interferencia. El sonido que reproducen a mi limitada apreciación es exactamente tal cual escuche durante la grabación de voz y guitarra usando un micrófono Hyperx Quad con media ganancia y patrón de cardioide. Estaba la tele prendida en el cuarto del lado, en la ventana carros y gente haciendo ruido moderado. Aún así, al reproducir mi grabación sin ningún tipo de modificación (efectos, etc) sonaba tal cual mis oídos escucharon durante la grabación. Es decir el sonido natural de tu voz y sus rebotes naturales en la habitación en la que te encuentras. Soy absolutamente amateur en grabación y cualquier cosa relacionada a la producción de audio, pero llevo mas de 20 años de músico entusiasta. No podría hablar de que tan buenos serían para profesionales, pero para personas que van comenzando y entusiastas me parecen que cumplen perfectamente con todos los requisitos.
review_title: Reproducen muy fielmente lo que grabas, tal cual lo escuchas.

date_and_country_pf_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 4, 2023
review: I'd just sent some highly rated Temu computer speakers back as they were so tinny in sound. At just over £75 I already knew of Pre Sonus quality from it's excellent Revelator mic I use all the time. The speakers feel solid. I like that the bass and treble are at the back as it gives a cleaner look to the speaker at the front. I was absolutely blown away by the clarity of the speakers. I'm a professional musician and have been buying audio gear for a lifetime. My spotify track list came to life. Prime sounded awesome. Bass I had to turn down! It's the separation of sound that is so impressive. I don't game but could imagine they work really well for that also as the balance of highs and lows are so impressive. At this price I've not seen anything that comes close. Only downside is no bluetooth but there is a new version of these that has it. Personally my Macmini M2 still has an audiojack in Yay! and I always think audio sounds better with a direct connection. You'll be hard pushed to find anything as good at this price.

The preamps in this have almost 70 decibels a gain, which means this will not struggle to power the most demanding of dynamic microphones, the first air mode adds a little bit of EQ which can make a darker microphone sound amazing the second air mode I don't particularly like as it really cuts out the mid-range and boost the highest and the lows and kind of makes it sound hollow on my voice

The software is very handy so you can control the gain from the knobs on the interface or right off the computer software which I think is awesome

The preamps give me a much more transparent sound and other preamps for example other interfaces I own seem to color the sound a little bit but they add a little something they alter the Sun that would say the word this one just sounds very neutral and transparent like it's not changing the sound at all

If you check out the Danny lightning audio tech channel on YouTube you can see this compared to a couple of other units I also did a review video and something about the software so you might want to check that out as well but I'll tell you what can I so far I'm very happy with this I just wish they would add a monitor mix and it'd be nice if the software gave you a little number so you can see if you're at like zero 50 80 100 and so on on the game if you know what I'm saying those are the only two complaints but besides those two things and not really liking the second air mode the overall sound quality is very good and I'm very happy with the unit I mainly use a sure sm7b most of the time but I have quite a few different microphones, I used to always EQ my Acura estimate 7B but with this unit I just turn on the first air know that I don't feel like I need to do any further EQ adjustments which is awesome so yeah I really like this thing
